page.title: 17OLD PEOPLE'S HOME
page.content: The people who own the home at Ladybank came to Sanday on holiday in summer time in 1984 to see what it was like. Then, in November they set it up. They can cater for ten people, but at the moment they have three people staying. They take people up to Sanday if they want a holiday and one person is coming up in August. They cater for as long as the person wants to stay. At the moment they are decorating the rooms but not changing the layout of the rooms if it can be helped. They have one modern kitchen. Showers and toilets are both upstairs and downstairs. They plan to put a fire escape upstairs. At the moment they are fitting in nurse call buttons. They are operated by lights. When the button is pressed the light goes on and they know which person needs help. The old folks have a T.V.in each room.
